description: Complex cognitive processes such as memory, language and spatial perception have a neurological basis. This course provides the opportunity to examine the relationship between human brain structures and their expression in cognition. Students examine cerebral asymmetry, head trauma, learning disabilities and aphasia. The course includes three hours lecture and three hours laboratory per week. Prerequisites: Psychology 125, 231, and 238 or Neuroscience 234; completion of BTS-T.
name: Human Neuropsychology
notes: Students in Psych 385 must also register for lab 385 L.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Psychology 125, 231, and 238 or Neuroscience 234; completion of BTS-T.
